item.title: Manhole cover not sitting correctly, 25th May
item.description:
Manhole cover raised up on one side and is a significant trip hazard. It is on the pavement on the Nine Elms Road and Cheltenham Road junction next to the Nine Elms Road sign.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, very dangerous to 2 wheeled traffic as it can't be avoided, 25th May
item.description:
A whole load of potholes covering both sides of the road. The only answer in my opinion is a short section of complete resurfacing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree urgently needs support, 25th May
item.description:
This is an area of council land at the rear of my property. the council planted this tree and have looked after it, but I reported in February that the tether was broken and it hasn't been fixed, and now look what's happened. Rear of 2 Tudor Lodge, 17 The Park, Cheltenham

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, The Park, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheelchair trolley abandoned end of Cooper Road junction of PE way, 25th May
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Cowper Road, Benhall, Cheltenham

item.title: Protruding ironworks, 24th May
item.description:
Lid of a manhole has tipped up and jammed in the hole, leaving a raised edge that could severely damage tyres or vehicles. In bus lane on B4063 near Arle Court roundabout.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Golden Valley, Cheltenham

item.title: Street light glass broken and lying on grass, 24th May
item.description:
The glass from the street light, number one, has broken and fallen to the ground. Currently it is sitting around the base of the street light but that's a hazard to anyone playing on the green or walking nearby. Possibly it was hit by the grass mowing contractor earlier in the week but I can't be sure.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Littlecote Close, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedges, 24th May
item.description:
The hedges by the bridge are overgrown it’s dangerous for the kids walking to school getting scratched by the brambles or walking into the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Two Hedges Road, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Large degradation of surface, 24th May
item.description:
Previously patched section in lane 2 southbound (2m long?) severely degraded and unavoidable. Witnessed cars swerving to avoid of if hit causes bounce of on steering. Location just before countdown markers for J11A
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Traffic lights hardly allowing traffic from Monson Avenue onto A4019 - prob less than 30 seconds, traffic backing up so people likely to be late for work - nearly 10 mins to get out of road because of traffic lights is unacceptable :(, 24th May
item.description:
See above

item.title: Broken Manhole Cover, 24th May
item.description:
On Gloucester St in Winchcombe at the junction with Malthouse Lane there is a broken manhole cover, half of it has sunk into the ground. Whenever vehicles pass over it it clangs extraordinary loudly and is causing us to be woken during the night. This has been reported before and inspected and then not fixed so please please can somebody fix this as the noise from it is driving us nuts.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Overgrown hedge, 23rd May
item.description:
This person trims their hedge a little bit it needs a good cut back because it’s overgrown into a big chunk of the footpath making it very Narrow and bikes come around the bend at speed and due to the overgrown hedge you don’t see the bike until they’re near on top of you. Please could the owner be asked to cut it right back so we have full access of the footpath again? There’s barely enough room for one person to get past, never mind a double buggy. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Arle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge overgrown, 23rd May
item.description:
The hedge is so overgrown that pedestrians have barely any room and if you dare walk in the bike lane you near get knocked over, get abuse for being in the cycle lane or some people do politely say excuse me please and u have to squeeze up against the hedge. It’s just needs cutting back so we have have the full pavement. Every year the pavement is getting smaller and smaller. It needs a good cutting back

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Arle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
